chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
About Eufimia the Abbess, similarly corrected.

In the same way, Eufimia, the noble abbess from the city of Metz, while traveling there, did not dismount to pray as everyone usually did. Shortly after, she fell from her horse and broke her leg. She was reluctantly carried to the church, and she regained her health through the merit of the blessed man.
chunks.original_latin:
De Eufimia abbatissa similiter emendata. 14. Eodem modo abbatissa nobilis ex urbe mediomatricorum
Eufimia, cum iter agens illuc devenisset,
et nec oratum, ut omnes consueverant descendisset,
paulo post de equo cecidit, et effracto
crure quae sponte noluerat ad ecclesiam portatur
 invita, et sanitatem, quam suo perdiderat, merito
beati viri recepit.
